title: Development of Mobile Mathematics Modules Based on Merrill’s Principles of Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of high school-level mathematics concepts and completion of introductory college mathematics courses
context.additional_context: A project-based assessment-centered mathematics education course conducted in a bring-your-own-device (BYOD) environment.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world problem situations presented according to Merrill’s principles of instruction and select appropriate mathematical models.
Learners can visualize and explain complex mathematical concepts through demonstration materials (animations, simulations) provided in mobile environments.
Learners can integrate acquired mathematical knowledge into project deliverables (portfolios, reports, etc.) while solving applied problems.
Learners can iteratively refine their problem-solving processes based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
